macros.sourceContext:
> | {{HTMLSidebar}} ^ |

HTML provides a crossorigin attribute for images that, in combination with an appropriate {{Glossary("CORS")}} header, allows images defined by the {{ HTMLElement("img") }} element that are loaded from foreign origins to be used in a {{HTMLElement("canvas")}} as if they had been loaded from the current origin.

|

See CORS settings attributes for details on how the crossorigin attribute is used.

macros.sourceContext:
> | {{HTMLSidebar}} ^ |

HTML provides a crossorigin attribute for images that, in combination with an appropriate {{Glossary("CORS")}} header, allows images defined by the {{ HTMLElement("img") }} element that are loaded from foreign origins to be used in a {{HTMLElement("canvas")}} as if they had been loaded from the current origin.

|

See CORS settings attributes for details on how the crossorigin attribute is used.

title: Allowing cross-origin use of images and canvas
summary: HTML provides a crossorigin attribute for images that, in combination with an appropriate CORS header, allows images defined by the element that are loaded from foreign origins to be used in a as if they had been loaded from the current origin.
short_title: Allowing cross-origin use of images and canvas
